channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: With a possible second Trump term looming, some DACA recipients are taking risks
item.description: DACA recipients are legally allowed to live and work in the U.S. However, the possibility of a second Trump presidency brings a lot of uncertainty for the over half a million DACA permit holders.
item.content:encoded: DACA recipients are legally allowed to live and work in the U.S. However, the possibility of a second Trump presidency brings a lot of uncertainty for the over half a million DACA permit holders.
item.dc:creator: Halle Zander

item.title: Democrats are split among calls for Biden to step aside
item.description: Multiple senior House Democrats told House Democratic leaders on Sunday that President Biden should step aside as the party's presidential nominee.
item.content:encoded: Multiple senior House Democrats told House Democratic leaders on Sunday that President Biden should step aside as the party's presidential nominee.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Volunteers who lived in a NASA-created Mars replica for over a year have emerged
item.description: The four crew members entered the 3D-printed Mars replica on June 25, 2023, as part of a NASA experiment to observe how humans would fare living on the Red Planet.
item.content:encoded:
The four crew members entered the 3D-printed Mars replica on June 25, 2023, as part of a NASA experiment to observe how humans would fare living on the Red Planet.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Amid growing calls for Biden to pull out, congressional Democrats remain split
item.description: Democrats continue to grapple with serious questions about President Biden's future as the party's nominee for president.
item.content:encoded:
Democrats continue to grapple with serious questions about President Biden's future as the party's nominee for president.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: Texas residents prepare for Beryl
item.description: People along the Texas coast are preparing for the landfall of Beryl. Forecasters say it will likely be a hurricane when it hits.
item.content:encoded: People along the Texas coast are preparing for the landfall of Beryl. Forecasters say it will likely be a hurricane when it hits.
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: What could reparations look like in California?
item.description: Cash payments to Black descendants of the formerly enslaved have been a key part of the reparations movement. California lawmakers have set aside $12 million, but cash payments aren’t in the plan.
item.content:encoded: Cash payments to Black descendants of the formerly enslaved have been a key part of the reparations movement. California lawmakers have set aside $12 million, but cash payments aren’t in the plan.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Rapper BG's lyrics will face government scrutiny. Is it a violation of free speech?
item.description: NPR's Adrian Florido speaks with attorney Alexandra Kazarian about the ways in which rap lyrics are used in the criminal justice system.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Florido speaks with attorney Alexandra Kazarian about the ways in which rap lyrics are used in the criminal justice system.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: How fibers spun from gelatin could help reduce textile waste
item.description: Michael Rivera, an assistant professor with The ATLAS Institute at the University of Colorado Boulder, talks about dissolvable fibers made from gelatin.
item.content:encoded: Michael Rivera, an assistant professor with The ATLAS Institute at the University of Colorado Boulder, talks about dissolvable fibers made from gelatin.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: French voters reject the far-right
item.description: French voters turned out in numbers not seen in decades to stop the far-right National Rally from taking power in the French National Assembly.
item.content:encoded: French voters turned out in numbers not seen in decades to stop the far-right National Rally from taking power in the French National Assembly.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Beryl is set to gain hurricane strength as it bears down on the Texas coast
item.description: Beryl is set to strengthen into a hurricane before making landfall along the Texas coast early Monday morning.
item.content:encoded:
Beryl is set to strengthen into a hurricane before making landfall along the Texas coast early Monday morning.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett
